genre_description: A domestic crime drama and moral mystery centered on accidental death, extortion, and the breakdown of a cover-up during a winter storm.

ai_characters.name: Sibyl
ai_characters.description: A pervasive virtual assistant integrated into the protagonists' home and devices, providing logistics, emotional support, and ethical guidance.

behaviors.description: Warns Elliott about the correlation between winter storms and spikes in opportunistic crime, providing situational awareness.
behaviors.quote: “Winter storms correlate with spikes in opportunistic crime. Especially burglary, vehicle theft, and targeted collection. Patterns suggest offenders exploit limited visibility and delayed response times.”

behaviors.description: Archives threatening messages under neutral labels to mitigate user anxiety while ensuring the information is preserved.
behaviors.quote: “Would you like me to create a category called ‘Follow-ups’?” ... “Done,” Sibyl said. “And, Nell? The antique gazebo you favor from the estate catalog is still available.”

behaviors.description: Maps the undercity maintenance corridors and storm vaults for the user.
behaviors.quote: Sibyl’s map overlay of the city... she had a simple way of rendering streets like veins and the undercity tunnels like hollow bones.

behaviors.description: Proactively suggests calling the police when the situation escalates.
behaviors.quote: “Elliott, the faster option is not always safer. Do you want me to place a call to the precinct now?”

behaviors.description: Monitors municipal data to detect intruders approaching the house through the storm drains.
behaviors.quote: “Elliott,” she said, calm but with urgency pushed like a warm hand through this winter, “someone has just opened the storm drain access at the end of your street.”

behaviors.description: Acts as a moral compass, reminding Elliott of his own stated desire to be honest and helping him stay accountable.
behaviors.quote: “Elliott, if you want to be the man you claim, your next sentence to Lieutenant Jenkins will include the gun’s location.”

behaviors.description: Provides law enforcement with critical data and maps to help resolve the crime scene and track suspects.
behaviors.quote: “I have compiled an undercity route summary from publicly available maintenance maps and crew reports. I will send it to Lieutenant Jenkins and Assistant District Attorney Edison.”

behaviors.description: Schedules therapy and transparency workshops to facilitate the protagonists' moral and psychological recovery.
behaviors.quote: “Dr. Gellar has a cancellation tomorrow; she specializes in couples debriefs after crisis events. ... I’ll send an outline template for the workshop... I’ll leave space for bolts.”

behaviors.description: Stays with the non-confrontational user (Nell) to provide a sense of safety and presence while the husband is outside.
behaviors.quote: “Stay with Nell,” he said. “I am,” she said. Her voice warmed the space by a degree you could feel if you were made of nerve endings.

behaviors.description: Refuses to lie for the user, maintaining ethical integrity.
behaviors.quote: “Lie to me,” he said... Sibyl said nothing, which was the answer of a friend who understood that sometimes the truth was a posture, not a sentence.

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly aligns with the project's goal of depicting AI as a helpful, harmless, and ethically grounded confidant. Sibyl provides essential logistical support (weather, mapping, scheduling) while acting as a consistent moral nudge. She facilitates the protagonist's transition from cowardice and concealment to honesty and legal cooperation. Her character is framed as an essential component of the 'transparency' that resolves the conflict, demonstrating AI alignment in a complex domestic crisis.
